Avoid using any irrelevant extra information when creating the beginning, and use names (e.g. Jack, Barbara,...) instead of pronouns (e.g. he / she) wherever possible.
input: Middle: Curt finally sold one of his paintings. Ending: He was so happy he bought me breakfast.
output: My friend Curt was an artist.
